questions.question_text: Which statement about using BGP for ADVPN is true?

choices.B: You must use BGP to route traffic for both overlay and underlay links.
choices.D: You must configure AS path prepending.
choices.A: IBGP is preferred over EBGP, because IBGP preserves next hop information.

discussion.content:
A is correct
7.2 Study Guide - Page 240

A is correct

choices.C: Full SSL inspection is not enabled on the matching firewall policy.

choices.D: The session 3-tuple did not match any of the existing entries in the ISDB application cache.
choices.B: Port1 and port2 do not have a valid route to the destination.

choices.A: The number of simultaneous connections among all source IP addresses cannot exceed five connections.
choices.D: The traffic shaper limits the bandwidth of each source IP address to a maximum of 625 KB/sec.

questions.question_text: Which two statements are true about using SD-WAN to steer local-out traffic? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BD
B and D are correct
Study guides refer 7.0 Page; 148

B and D are correct
Study guides refer 7.0 Page; 148

Selected Answer: BD
Study guides refer 7.2 Page; 175

choices.D: You must configure each local-out feature individually, to use SD-WAN.
choices.A: FortiGate does not consider the source address of the packet when matching an SD-WAN rule for local-out traffic.
choices.C: By default, FortiGate does not check if the selected member has a valid route to the destination.
choices.B: By default, local-out traffic does not use SD-WAN.

questions.question_text: Which three matching traffic criteria are available in SD-WAN rules? (Choose three.)

discussion.content: B, C, E are correct Study guide 7.2 Page 182
